tweet_full_text: b'.@MandyRheaWrites never expected to become National Teacher of the Year. But now that she is, her platform has helped more teachers get involved in education policy. https://t.co/HPCvB80lyK'

b'Scientists announced last week that they have finally cracked the wheat genome. This is incredibly exciting news xe2x80x94 and could have a positive impact on global food security: https://t.co/q3bM824h0q https://t.co/ey8foTkBaf'
b'I recently sat down with a super-talented teacher named Mandy Manning. Her approach to helping immigrant and refugee teens succeed inspires me: https://t.co/mRLorlU4Zl https://t.co/AYags6z4xz'
b'Melinda and I are big fans of @DonorsChoose. Find a project that inspires you, and our foundation will give your donation a boost: https://t.co/PjWPRhiPVW https://t.co/7tmhtXuV3a'

b'National Teacher of the Year Mandy Manning is one of the most remarkable educators I have ever met. Her dedication to helping her students succeed, despite the odds, fills me with hope. https://t.co/sQ4I83N6wE'

b'I hate mosquitoes. The diseases they spread kill more than half a million people every year. In fact, mosquitoes kill more people in one day than sharks kill in 100 years: https://t.co/r81u9DDB2B #WorldMosquitoDay https://t.co/j6DB4yZ4m9'
b'Kofi Annan was one of the great peacemakers of our time. I was fortunate to have the opportunity to work with him on many occasions. Ixe2x80x99m sad to learn of his death. https://t.co/VM9QJyzaT3'

b'If you want to understand why this matters, I highly recommend the new book xe2x80x9cCapitalism Without Capitalxe2x80x9d by @haskelecon and @stianwestlake. Herexe2x80x99s my review: https://t.co/7VU7i8wvPA'

b'The portion of the global economy that doesnxe2x80x99t fit the old model just keeps getting larger. But the rules that govern the economy havenxe2x80x99t kept up. This is one of the biggest trends in the global economy that isnxe2x80x99t getting enough attention.'

b'Unlike the goods that powered our economy in the past, software is an intangible asset -- xe2x80x9csomething you canxe2x80x99t touch.xe2x80x9d And itxe2x80x99s not the only example: data, insurance, e-books, even movies work in similar ways.'
b'But software doesnxe2x80x99t work like this. Microsoft might spend a lot of money to develop the first unit of a new program, but every unit after that is virtually free to produce.'
b'This chart assumes that the total cost of production increases as supply increases. When a car company makes a new vehicle, the 10th car costs the same to manufacture as the 1000th.'
b'At the time I was in college, this was basically how the global economy worked... https://t.co/2polaSbsXY'

bMy friend @PaulGAllen's @LivingComputers Museum & Lab is a great place to learn about the tech revolution and what will come next. (It also has a working Altair 8800 xe2x80x93 very cool) https://t.co/bxtBhEREhE

b'One in five students who plan to attend college donxe2x80x99t actually enroll. @GeorgiaStateU, a school I visited last year, used chatbots to reduce xe2x80x9csummer meltxe2x80x9d by 21%: https://t.co/OatrCs5Z54 https://t.co/G99itf15dO'

b'Congrats to @PearlJam on bringing together so many incredible partners and fans to fight homelessness in my hometown of Seattle. This is the kind of leadership we need more of in our city and beyond. #TheHomeShows https://t.co/0f1TTQhO0M'
b'In celebration of #BookLoversDay, here are five of my recent favorites. I think youxe2x80x99ll find therexe2x80x99s something for everyone: https://t.co/bvggr1jdas https://t.co/0q0qHv5su2'
b'What fuels my optimism for the future? The data (because it tells a pretty remarkable story). https://t.co/NQAWAanLYo'

b'The transformation of Rwandaxe2x80x99s health system has its roots in a very simple, but powerful belief: everyone deserves a shot at a healthy life, no matter their income, ethnic group, or where they call home. https://t.co/qRbsrnBwho'
b'Foreign aid is one of the best investments that the U.S. can make. Now is the time to strengthen programs like n@PEPFAR. https://t.co/vFHR9bY1Vx'

b'.@theGFF helps countries to develop low-cost, high-impact solutions to their pressing health problems. Kangaroo care is a great example of the interventions that they promote: https://t.co/H48rjYg1xk https://t.co/MRtyrhBhqO'

bI read @TheEconomist cover-to-cover because its content makes me think critically about the world. Its editors recently asked me a tough question: What is the one thing you'd do to create a more open world? See my answer below and share your answer here: https://t.co/snng1yCdRL https://t.co/J4uL2ccLcd

b'We need a reliable, affordable, and accessible diagnostic for Alzheimerxe2x80x99s disease. If you have a bold idea, I encourage you to apply for funding on the new Diagnostics Accelerator website: https://t.co/oNJH0CTgBc https://t.co/YcpZhyZtfd'
b'RT @MaxCRoser: Much of the reduction of child deaths in the last generation was achieved because of a reduction of deaths caused by vaccinexe2x80xa6'

b'Alzheimerxe2x80x99s research is one of the most exciting frontiers of science. Ixe2x80x99m optimistic we can alter the course of the disease if we make progress in five key areas, including the development of a better diagnostic: https://t.co/nChla7AA2T https://t.co/SWyK5r4Vb2'
b'.@mariashriver the opportunity to learn from you and other members of the Alzheimerxe2x80x99s community has made me more optimistic than ever. https://t.co/ivlnUTi78H'

His message to graduates was simple yet profound: xe2x80x9cDo not be afraid to let your light shine.xe2x80x9d https://t.co/TYVQc2kOSH'
